tn.text: This introduces a new event in the story. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_newevent]])

tn.ref: Haman son of Hammedatha the Agagite
tn.text: This is the name and description of Haman, one of the king's officials. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: placed his seat of authority above all the officials who were with him
tn.text: Here "seat of authority" represents his position or status in the government. AT: "promoted him above the other officials" or "gave him more authority than all the other officials" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
These acts represent submission to the authority of Haman. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
"humbled themselves and lay flat on the ground before Haman"

tn.ref: to see if the matter about Mordecai would remain like that
tn.text: "to find out what Haman would do about Mordecai's actions"

tn.ref: did not kneel and bow down
tn.text: Mordecai showed disrespect for Haman's status in the government by not doing these actions. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
Here Haman's rage is spoken of as something that could fill him up. AT: "Haman became very angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: He had contempt for the idea of killing only Mordecai
tn.text: "He rejected the idea of killing just Mordecai." This can also be stated in positive form. AT: "He wanted to kill more than just Mordecai"
"get rid of all the Jews" or "kill all the Jews"
"In month one" (See:  [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: which is the month of Nisan
tn.text: "Nisan" is the name of the first month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of March and the first part April on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: in the twelfth year of King Ahasuerus
tn.text: "in year number 12 of King Ahasuerus" or "when King Ahasuerus had reigned for about twelve years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: the Pur—that is the lot—was thrown
tn.text: "they cast the Pur—that is the lot—" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"month twelve" (See:  [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

"Adar" is the name of the twelfth and last month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of February and the first part of March on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"a group of people." This refers to the Jews as an ethnic group.
"who live in many different places"
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:01|1:1]].

tn.ref: it is not suitable for the king to let them stay
tn.text: "the king should not let them remain." This can also be stated in positive form. AT: "the king should remove them"
Haman speaks to the king in the third person as a sign of respect. AT: "your ... you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])

tn.ref: I will weigh out ... into the hands of those
tn.text: Here "hands" stands for the men. To "weigh out" is an idiom that means to pay them. AT: "I will pay ... to the men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"340 metric tons of silver" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
a special ring that could be used to imprint the king's official seal on a proclamation.

tn.ref: I will see that the money is given back to you
tn.text: The meaning of this phrase is not clear. Possible meanings are 1) "I will return the money to you" or 2) "Take the money and give it to the men just as you have said." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the king's scribes were summoned ... a decree containing all that Haman had commanded was written
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The king summoned his scribes ... they wrote a decree containing all that Haman had commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: thirteenth day of the first month
tn.text: This is the first month of the Hebrew calendar. The thirteenth day is near the beginning of April on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"governors of the provinces." Translate "province" as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:01|1:1]].

tn.ref: It was written in the name of King Ahasuerus and was sealed with his ring
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They wrote the decree in the name of King Ahasuerus and Haman sealed it with the king's signet ring" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "name" represents the authority of the king. AT: "in the authority of" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
delivered** - This idiom means they personally delivered the letters. AT: "personally delivered" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
These words mean the same thing and emphasize the completeness of the destruction. AT: "completely destroy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: thirteenth day of the twelfth month
tn.text: "day thirteen of month twelve." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: which is the month of Adar
tn.text: "Adar" is the name of the twelfth and last month of the Hebrew calendar. The thirteenth day is near the beginning of March on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and  [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"take away"

tn.ref: A copy of the letter was made law in every province
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The officials in every province made a copy of the letter become the law" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:01|1:1]].

tn.ref: In every province it was made known to all the people
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They told all the people in every province" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"that day"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "They also distributed the decree" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
(See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"was in a state of great confusion"
